text: Yves Jarvis is the stage name of Jean-Sébastien Audet,"Yves Jarvis: The Same but by Different Means". Pitchfork, March 9, 2019. a Canadian indie pop musician who also previously released music under the stage name Un Blonde."Un Blonde Changes Name to Yves Jarvis, Announces New Album". Exclaim!, December 11, 2018. Originally from Calgary, Alberta, he released Tenet, his first album as Un Blonde, in 2014."Jean-Sebastien Audet Refuses to Sit Still as Yves Jarvis". BeatRoute, May 6, 2019. He followed up in 2016 with Good Will Come to You,"Un Blonde Is Re-Releasing His Best, Most Spiritual Album. Now’s Your Chance To Get Sanctified". The Fader, September 13, 2017. which was a longlisted nominee for the 2016 Polaris Music Prize."Polaris Prize 2016 Long List: Drake, Carly Rae Jepsen, Grimes, the Weeknd, and More". Spin, June 15, 2016. The album was reissued in 2017 on Flemish Eye."Un Blonde: Good Will Come to You". Exclaim!, September 20, 2017. Audet announced in 2018 that he was changing his stage name from Un Blonde to Yves Jarvis, and released his third album The Same but by Different Means in early 2019 on Flemish Eye in Canada and ANTI- in the rest of the world. The album was longlisted for the 2019 Polaris Music Prize."Find out who made the 2019 Polaris Music Prize long list". CBC Music, June 20, 2019. ==References== Category:21st-century Canadian singers Category:Canadian indie pop musicians Category:Canadian indie rock musicians Category:Canadian experimental musicians Category:Canadian rock singers Category:Musicians from Calgary Category:Black Canadian singers Category:Living people Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Franco-Albertan people
title: Yves Jarvis
